abstract: trump is said to plan extension of iran sanctions waivers .
article: -- u. s. president donald trump plans to extend waivers on sanctions against iran that were required as part of a 2015 nuclear deal as congress weighs legislation meant to fix what the administration considers flaws with the agreement , according to an administration official familiar with the matter . trump must decide by jan. . 12 whether to extend relief from 2012 sanctions that largely cut iran 's central bank off from the international financial system . waiving those sanctions was required under the nuclear agreement with iran and other world powers , and reimposing them would have effectively scuttled the deal .

the administration official , who asked not to be identified discussing private deliberations , stressed that no final decision had been made and the administration 's plans could change at any time . trump has repeatedly railed against the nuclear accord , calling it the `` worst deal ever . '' the associated press reported on the administration 's plans earlier on wednesday . to contact the reporter on this story : nick wadhams in washington at nwadhams@bloomberg . net . to contact the editors responsible for this story : bill faries at wfaries@bloomberg . net , mike dorning Â© 2018 bloomberg l. p.
